result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell Ross Barron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).
  • Manuf'r Falsely Present NonDrug as Drug, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--Buy Money Reimbursement in the amount of $590, joint and several with Maxwell McDonald
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalysis (at least once per month for the first three months; thereafter, at the discretion of the Agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no contact with Maxwell McDonald, Nicholas Hermann, Tyler McGinnis, Caleb Sperber, or Zachary Carroll
--40 hours of community service (total) designed primarily to educate youth about the dangers of drugs, to be monitored by the Agent
--no contact with any drug offender except for treatment purposes, per Agent

Arresting Agency: WWPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, on each count, to be served concurrent with each other to commence on 10/22/15 at  6:00pm.

--The Court does not object to Mr. Barron traveling to Dane Co. for purposes of work

---Mr.Barron is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

Cases 14CF390 and 15CF142 called together at 1:30pm [mo]
Defendant Mitchell Ross Barron in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF142:
DA Happ requests a Preliminary Hearing or STC out 30 days 
--no objection from Atty. Eisenburg

The Court reminds Mr. Barron that his bond and conditions remain in effect in case 15CF142

As to Case 14CF390:
Service of Amended Information admitted; reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 and Count #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to serve 60 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work-release privileges, on each count, to be served concurrent with each other to commence on 10/22/15 at  6:00pm.
--The Court does not object to Mr. Barron traveling to Dane Co. for purposes of work
---Mr.Barron is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalysis (at least once per month for the first three months; thereafter, at the discretion of the Agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of a controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no contact with Maxwell McDonald, Nicholas Hermann, Tyler McGinnis, Caleb Sperber, or Zachary Carroll
--40 hours of community service (total) designed primarily to educate youth about the dangers of drugs, to be monitored by the Agent
--no contact with any drug offender except for treatment purposes, per Agent
--On Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--Buy Money Reimbursement in the amount of $590, joint and several with Maxwell McDonald

Days credit for time already served:  0 days

recess:1:49pm

Copy of email w/criminal case settlement submitted over the bench by Attorney Eisenberg

Cases 14CF390 & 15CF142 called together at 9:11 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for sentencing & plea/sentencing)
Defendant Mitchell Ross Barron in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ: Cases had been set for sentencing, subsequent to original plea did review reports. Substance at time of delivery was not a controlled substance, MDMA. Do believe that pleas should be withdrawn and State will prepare amended information. Requests matter be set in approx. 30 days - The Walworth County Case was consolidated, but that will no longer be consolidated. State's amended information will only include Counts #1 & #2 and Count #3 which was the Walworth County charge, will be removed.

Atty Eisenberg requests that before cases are un-consolidated, would like to speak to Walworth County DA. Will withdraw pleas and work again on settlement. Main issue is expungement at this time, both counties are not in agreement with this part of settlement. Have discussed withdrawl of pleas with Mr. Baron. 
Mr. Baron agrees that plea shall be withdrawn. 

Court finds that there no longer exists a adequate factual basis to accept the pleas; the Court withdraws the pleas in case 14CF390, and orders that the judgment of convictions on each count be vacated. Any Count read-in and dismissed shall be reinstated. Court finds that the withdrawl of plea is knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently made.
Atty Eisenberg submits copy of email re: contact with Walworth County
Court reminds Mr. Baron that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 9:20 am

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing in approximately 30 days - Send notices **Counsel to contact the Court's JA for scheduling with Judge Koschnick**
Sentencing hearing at 07-16-2015 09:00 am
Scheduling Notice

[Reserve Judge Mawdsley presides for Branch IV]
Cases 15CF142 & 14CF390 called together at 11:10am [mo]
Defendant Mitchell Ross Barron in court with Attorney Mark Eisenberg .   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF142(Initial Appearance Occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1500   Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with Tyler McGinnis
--no presence at the UW- Whitewater Campus
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking

As to Case 14CF390(Status Conference occurs):
Atty Eisenburg indicates that a global resolution will be made and requests a joint plea and sentencing date out 30 days

recess: 11:15am

Case called at 8:54 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Mitchell Ross Barron in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Eisenberg submits Plea questionnaire, proposed STAO to consolidate, waiver, criminal case settlement & waiver of prelim paperwork
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Eisenberg confirms that he was successful in consolidating this case with the Walworth County Case
Court vacates warrant; Court endorses proposed STAO for consolidation

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Barron waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2 & #3; Atty Eisenberg submits copy of Walworth County complaint-factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#1
Atty Eisenberg requests sentencing be set out after May 22nd. Do understand that it will be likely that Mr. Barron will report for any jail imposed forthwith & will be prepared.
Court proposes proceeding with sentencing and setting out jail report date
Atty Eisenberg requests sentencing be set in April and jail report time set out in May, presents basis
ADA Shock: State does not object to jail term beginning 5/23/15 to allow Mr. Barron to finish school
Court notes It is inclined to follow request re: jail report date
Court reminds Mr. Barron that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending - Reviews conditions of bond with Mr. Barron
Recess: 9:18 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 4/23/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
from non-party in support of the defendant  submitted by Attorney Eisenberg
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 5, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Case called at 8:42am[MO]
 Defendant Mitchell Barron does not appear. Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Eisenburg indicates that Mr. Barron is enrolled in college courses and was under the impression he did not have to attend todays hearing.
The Court authorizes issuance of a bench warrant for Mr. Barron, body only, but stays execution of warrant until the next hearing. 
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. Atty. Eisenburg seeks several weeks to continue efforts regarding case consolidation with Walworth County cases.  
Recess: 8:46am
